item.title: Please remove it!, 9th June

item.title: Exterior light on council property causing major pollution, 9th June
item.description:
The light shines directly into our back windows, even though its some way off its very bright especially when completely dark. Can it please either be tilted down or a cover added to block horizontal rays of light escaping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Ashmere Grove, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water ingress into the property., 9th June
item.description:
Dear Sirs, Caledonia House - 223 Pentonville road, London, N1 9NG During the recent rainfall again during the weekend 7/06/25. We have had some water damage into our basement again. We believe the issue is related to the exterior areas of the property with rainwater getting in. See attached. The arrow pointing to the pavement is directly below in the lower ground floor the area which is affecting our property with water ingress. There is also a manhole on the roadway near the kerb. We need to know what this manhole relates to if it's storm water. As there could be a potential blockage. TFL are saying it's not them you are saying it not your liability also. I have tried different avenues I need to now know who is responsible for this? So, we can get the manhole open to see if there is a potential issue. Please could you let us know on this ASAP? And put me in contact with the person who can assist me. Thank you in advance and I look forward to hearing at your soonest. Kind Regards, Sam

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 223, Pentonville Road, Barnsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign missing , ( road closed , diversion, no traffic management under the road act, 9th June
item.description:
Under the regulation CoD of practice , streetwork road act 1991. The signs for road work should be visibility, and diversion sign , but no road closed sign .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-11, Albemarle Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litters, 9th June
item.description:
I’m writing to report an ongoing issue with litter accumulation at the corner of Eastview Avenue and Swingate Lane. The entire square appears to be filled with litter, which has now been present for at least two weeks. This suggests the area is not being cleaned regularly. I kindly request that this be addressed and the litter removed at the earliest opportunity, as it is unsightly and detracts from the appearance of the local area. Thank you for your attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastview Avenue, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
